setPlainObject
Setting an attribute value of a primitive object.
Syntax
setPlainObject
(primObj, attr, value, index: inValue)
Parameter
Purpose
primObj
A primitive
object with a unique index
,
learn more about primitive objects
.
attr
A passable attribute of a primitive object.
value
The value of the selected attribute to be specified instead of the dummy variable
"null"
.
index
A unique index of the selected object.
inValue
The value of the unique index.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in Algorithm editor on the "Objects" tab.
In the modal window, select the following:
1. A primitive object
a unique index in the left column "Primitive object type"
.
2. A transferred attribute of the primitive object
in the right column "Attribute type"
.
3. Click the "Choose" button.
Then specify the transmitted value for the selected attribute (the "value" parameter) and the value of the unique index.
Example
Write the algorithm to transfer the value to the attribute "Name" of the primitive object "Plain_obj" with the ID number (index) "S777-7777-7777-77":
As the name is a string attribute, its value is indicated in quotation marks.
